From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To configure the default frequency time to scan modem signals, use the **default-value modem-interval** command in global configuration mode. To disable the configured frequency, use the **no** form of this command.

ParaDef.Info: Time frequency, in milliseconds (ms). The range is from 0 to 1000.

Examples: The following example shows how to set the default time to scan the modem signal to 345 ms:

RelatedCmds.description: Configures the default size of bits handled to either 7 bits or 8 bits.
Defines the EXEC character width to either 7 bits or 8 bits.
Configures the flow control default value from a 7-bit width to an 8-bit width.
